meta: A canonical name to specify a particular overall synthesis method used for synthesis. For example: "raphite oxide was prepared by oxidation of graphite powder according to the modified [Hummers' method]", "Bi2S3 nanorods with orthorhombic structure were prepared through the [hydrothermal method]", "Graphene oxide (GO) was prepared from graphite powder by the [Staudenmaier method]".
material: Materials that are used in the synthesis of the target. For example: Cr2O3, Strontium carbonate, BaTiO3, Li2CO3, Water, Ethanol.
nonrecipe-material: Chemically specified materials that are not used in the synthesis of the synthesis target. For example: "BaTiO3 powder ([Ba]/[Ti]=0.999)", "Li2CO3 was used as the [Li] source", "[Si]/[Al] ratio was 5".
operation: Discrete actions physically performed by the researcher or discrete process steps taken to synthesize the target.
amount-unit: These describe absolute amounts, concentrations, purities, ratios, flow rates and so on. For example: mg, mL, M, %.
characterization-apparatus: Equipment used to characterize a materials properties.
synthesis-apparatus: Equipment used to perform an operation involved in the synthesis.
material-descriptor: Describes a material' s structure, shape, form, type, role, etc. and must be directly or nearly adjacent to the material it describes. Does not include amounts, concentrations, or purities of materials. For example:  "[CaCu3Ti4O12] compound", "Copper [ion]", "GaAs [nanowires]". "[Anatase] TiO2", "[Deionized] water".
condition-unit: These describe the units of measurement for intangible conditions under which operations are performed. For ex: Â°C, K, sec, RPM, mW.
condition-misc: Qualitative descriptions of conditions. For example: Room temperature, Dropwise, Naturally, Vacuum.
next_operation: A relation intended to denote the true synthesis order of the synthesis steps; the relation is also intended to implicitly denote the flow of intermediate materials in the synthesis. However, in this first release of the data, as a placeholder for future annotations, Next-Operation is used simply used to indicate the next operation in text order rather than in true synthesis order.
amount_of: Links a number entity to the corresponding unit of measurement.
coref_of: Intended to capture coreferent mentions of entities presented by abbreviations, text in parenthesis and so on. For example: "Air(O2/N2 mixture gases)" and "He were supplied to the porous support side . . . ". "Air" is coreferent with O2 and N2.
apparatus_of: Denotes an apparatus to be used in a synthesis operation.
recipe_precursor: Indicates a material which is the source of an element for the target material used in a specific synthesis operation.
recipe_target: Indicates a material assigned to an operation which is the target of the synthesis procedure.
participant_material: A material that is part of a particular synthesis step.
